intro: Phyllanthus timoriensis, commonly known as the Timor sandbur, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny seed pods. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has small, alternate leaves and produces yellowish flowers that attract various pollinators. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
